channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Market Wrap
item.title: Market wrap: all the leasing and sales activity in and around Sydney

item.description: The squad will now spend 18 days at their lockdown accommodation, and exit just a week before the competition's planned resumption.
item.title: Warriors extend Tamworth lockdown stay after another player joins squad

item.dc:creator: Kate Lahey
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia's death toll stands at 97, aide to US vice president tests positive, Premier hints at return to school

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: South Australian Derby favourite Dalasan is looking to avenge his Caulfield Guineas defeat and claim his first group 1 at Morphettville on Saturday.
item.title: Inside Running: Group 1 chance for Dalasan

item.description: Chinese ambassador to Germany signals a softening towards Australia's call for an international investigation.
item.title: China open to probe of origins of new coronavirus: ambassador

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The two AFL states that stand to lose most from the league restarting the 2020 season on a charter flight system of home-and-away fixturing has each had one of its clubs illustrate why the industry is so against the initial quarantine hub model.
item.title: Bordering on stupid: State of AFL season rests with players

item.description: With so many of us sticking strictly to the social distancing rules gardens have never looked better around Australia, and Mother's Day is a chance to extend this success.
item.title: Your guide to Mother's Day delights in the garden

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: As local job losses continue to mount in the wake of COVID-19, an alarming picture has begun to emerge as businesses and workers scramble to make sense of their new financial circumstances.
item.title: Lost your job in WA due to COVID-19, and think you got a raw deal? You're not alone

item.description: Sydney living with Coronavirus - May 8, 2020
item.title: Sydney living with Coronavirus - May 8, 2020

item.description: The robot named SPOT has been deployed in a two-week trial to enforce coronavirus social distancing rules.
item.title: Roaming 'robodog' tells Singapore park goers to keep their distance

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Police allege a motorcyclist repeatedly rammed his bike into the open passenger door of a police car.
item.title: Officer forced to dive for safety as police car rammed

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Seventy-five years after the surrender of Nazi Germany, the Queen has delivered a historic speech referencing Britain's coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: 'Streets filled with love': The Queen gets personal in VE Day broadcast

item.description: More than two months after a black man was shot to death while jogging through a Georgia neighbourhood, the white father and son arrested in the case have appeared in court.
item.title: Father and son face court charged with Ahmaud Arbery's murder

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 restrictions eased across Australia as COVIDSafe app source code partially released, nation's death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: COVID-19 does not appear to have led to a significant increase in deaths in Australia, an analysis of state and territory data commissioned by The Age has found.
item.title: Australia avoids COVID-19 'missing deaths' phenomenon, data shows

item.description: Mike Pence's press secretary, the wife of one of President Donald Trump's senior advisers, has tested positive for the coronavirus, raising alarm about the virus' potential spread within the White House's inner most circle.
item.title: Member of Mike Pence's staff tests positive for coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Tatyana Leonov
item.description: When my husband and I first found out we were having another baby we thought we’d be telling loved ones in person, but things changed.
item.title: 'Things changed and that's OK': Navigating pregnancy during the pandemic

item.description: Nearly all the job growth achieved during the 11-year recovery from the Global Financial Crisis has now been lost in one month.
item.title: US unemployment surges to a Depression-era level of 14.7 per cent

item.description: A child died in a New York City hospital this week from what appeared to be a rare syndrome linked to the coronavirus that causes life-threatening inflammation in critical organs.
item.title: Child in New York dies and rare syndrome tied to coronavirus is suspected

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: No long tea-room chats or use of the communal crockery. Vast distances between desks will be the new normal when offices throw open the doors again.
item.title: Return to the office a whole new ball game: bring in the COVID captain

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Experts warn the Morrison government is not using its legal powers to protect wildlife from devastating bushfires losses.
item.title: Commonwealth ignores 'legally binding' role in bushfire nature protection

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: Author Favel Parrett is writing her first children's book, based on the true story of a baby dingo that fell from the sky.
item.title: The wonder of Wandi, a baby dingo that fell from the sky

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian has a roadmap to freedom but stressed that the onus is on everyone to keep their distance if they want restrictions gone for good.
item.title: Berejiklian's roadmap to freedom in NSW

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: In this recession, we have new ways of picking up the damage done - we should pay attention.
item.title: The hidden costs of the pandemic

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Respect aged care workers, who are "heroes", federal aged care minister warns.
item.title: Minister slams reports of 'harassment' of nursing home staff

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Aged care facility Newmarch House has been weathering what its chief executive calls a "perfect storm" as it battles a deadly coronavirus outbreak.
item.title: Wreaking deadly havoc: how the outbreak spiralled at Newmarch House

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: Eastern suburbs GP, Dr Joe Grech, has been involved in drug supply and possession, and providing false medical certificates, a police dossier shows.
item.title: Police dossier alleges Sydney GP exchanged certificates for drugs

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Throughout history plagues have sparked panics and calls for social reform. But history is not clear-cut on whether they cause real long-term change.
item.title: 'We want to rationalise': Plagues past, plagues present

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: When Bob Thompson saw the TV crew outside the school, the military man knew he finally had the numbers to attack and save children from abuse.
item.title: The war hero who wouldn't be silenced

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: While hibernation is a comforting metaphor for what's happened to out economy during the pandemic, there's no guarantee we'll emerge from the cave in the same shape as we went in.
item.title: Economic managers bank on us being as smart as the average bear

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: ME Bank backflips on a controversial policy and says it is "deeply sorry" after blindsiding more than 20,000 customers and damaging its reputation.
item.title: ME Bank's epic PR fail results in policy reversal

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Many of the Australians who took out loans with boutique outfit ME Bank thought they were giving their business to an institution with a different culture.
item.title: The 'bank for me' or a 'bank for them'? The week ME Bank was hit by a customer revolt

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: As the country moves from a national mobilisation to stop the virus to the next phase, Australia can take a moment to take note of its success.
item.title: 'Three decisions and a two-point plan': How Australia got on top of COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The UK Premiership provides a model for Australian rugby's future according to a sports consultancy group.
item.title: Forget the Kiwis, Australian rugby's future is local

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The trial will look into whether the anti-inflammatory can help patients who are experiencing serious lung inflammation from the late stage of the disease.
item.title: Trial begins of arthritis drug to treat critical COVID-19 patients

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: There was a fascinating dynamic between Luc Longley and Michael Jordan at the Chicago Bulls in the 1990s, but the Australian wasn't interviewed for The Last Dance - and also refused to comment on it.
item.title: Longley's deafening silence on Jordan and Bulls documentary

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, May 9

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Like many musicians, buskers and street performers have felt the brunt of the coronavirus shutdown.
item.title: 'Completely wiped out': banned buskers eager to return to city streets

item.description: Catholics have been left disheartened and disillusioned with the continuing revelations about their church.
item.title: Victims should come before institutions

item.description: Mother's Day will no doubt be different this year but whether you're planning a video call, or visiting a loved one in person, experts say every bit counts.
item.title: How to safely visit your grandmother in a nursing home

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: The women and the young are the big losers from the Great Lockdown and appeals to cut immigration will do nothing for them.
item.title: Keneally has picked the wrong fight for this pink-collar recession

item.dc:creator: Clive Hamilton
item.description: We wait to see if he can back it up, but the President’s claim is not without basis.
item.title: It would be unwise to dismiss Donald Trump's Wuhan lab leak theory

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: The Silverchair frontman received $170,000 in addition to having his legal costs of up to $300,000 covered by the media company.
item.title: Musician Daniel Johns receives six-figure settlement from News Corp

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The retail sector is knuckling down for a bitter winter with a loosening of social distancing measures unlikely to deliver an immediate boost.
item.title: Reopening stores the first step in a long road to retail recovery

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: A long-held North Bondi landmark site on the famous Campbell Parade, known to locals as Nio and Tony's, is set to test the market.
item.title: North Bondi landmark site could fetch $20m as market thaws

item.description: Foy & Gibsons' red-brick buildings in Collingwood is now home to Lasalle College International.
item.title: Education the spotlight in Foy & Gibsons holistic redesign

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: We bestow development rights – even on public land – without getting anything back, especially social housing. Developers reap millions while children and families sleep in the street. That’s obscene.
item.title: Here we go again, sacrificing the soul of our city for more towers of power

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: Animal protection body, the RSPCA can expect a tidy windfall from the sale of three Deepdene properties that belonged to its late president Hugh Wirth.
item.title: Deepdene windfall boosts animal rescue group

item.dc:creator: Louise Rugendyke
item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows, music and podcasts you might have missed.
item.title: Five so-bad-they're-good TV mothers
